issue.title: 2.7.0-alpha1 crashes when saving large project with SVGs and Texts
issue.body:
### Description of the bug

Prusaslicer crashes (maybe not always, I will dig deeper) saving a project with multiple (16, but previous crashes where with less) Objects.

Only have the G-Code left so I attatched a screenshot of the G-Code to show what I actually wanted to save... 
![image](https://github.com/prusa3d/PrusaSlicer/assets/39572092/3358fd32-deba-4a75-a8eb-68cc7b444d0b)

Here is the last dump from wich i did the screenshot.
[prusa-slicer.exe(1).30716.dmp](https://github.com/prusa3d/PrusaSlicer/files/13187980/prusa-slicer.exe.1.30716.dmp)

These three dumps whrere caused by the same issue, but there where not as many objects on the buildplate. Sorry I don't remember exactly. I hope they help anyways.
[prusa-slicer.exe.5804.dmp](https://github.com/prusa3d/PrusaSlicer/files/13187970/prusa-slicer.exe.5804.dmp)
[prusa-slicer.exe.12496.dmp](https://github.com/prusa3d/PrusaSlicer/files/13187990/prusa-slicer.exe.12496.dmp)
[prusa-slicer.exe.31456.dmp](https://github.com/prusa3d/PrusaSlicer/files/13187493/prusa-slicer.exe.31456.dmp)

BTW: I absolutely love PrusaSlicer and the MINI! Great work!

### Project file & How to reproduce

A I cannot save the project I only can attatch the source files.

The object is from https://www.printables.com/de/model/510422-bottletag-v2/comments/1226231
SVG is ![this](https://github.com/prusa3d/PrusaSlicer/assets/39572092/83e27405-8137-4fd0-bc4b-1876fb361523).
Text was in Consolas, 10mm 0x{twoHexDigits}

![image](https://github.com/prusa3d/PrusaSlicer/assets/39572092/f4522b2e-8940-40f7-b93f-c156ebf7e33f)

Copy the master around and try to save the project.


### Checklist of files included above

- [ ] Project file
- [X] Screenshot

### Version of PrusaSlicer

2.7.0-alpha1

### Operating system

Windows 10 22H2 (Build 19045.3570)

### Printer model

Prusa MINI

issue.title: Dynamic/variable line speed
issue.body:
Is any chance to make dynamic line speed like _Dynamic overhang speed_ but for straight lines by some treshold?
Let's say, i have large cubic object with vertical holes. For straight 'outer' perimeters is high printing speed possible and wanted, but holes are curved, there i want much slower speed for better result, but they are printed same as perimeter speed. So i must set all perimeter speed safe for curved/short lines. And that is slooow, so slooow...

Example: line length above 10mm = 100% speed, below 10mm = 60%, below 5mm = 30%

issue.title: Pressure Equalizer causes relative moves from Custom GCODE to be copied to Main GCODE
issue.body:
### Description of the bug

### TLDR:
*I have a custom color change GCODE that utilizes relative positioning to move the Z axis up 30mm, then down 30mm(then sets back to absolute positioning). When the pressure equalizer settings are enabled, it causes G1 Z-30 moves to be inserted unpredictably/repeatedly on the regular extruding GCODE.*

### More:
I set up a custom color changing GCODE to help with several simple two color prints I needed to do. PrusaSlicer does not support the "layer_z" or other similar variables in the color change GCODE, so I had to just use relative positioning to get the job done. Here is what I wrote:

```
G91 ; relative positioning
M83 ; extruder relative mode
G92 E0 ;Reset Extruder

G1 E-2 F6000 ; quick retract
G1 Z30 F1000 ; move up
G1 E-100 F300 ; unload

M300 P100 S3000 ; play tone
G4 P500 ; Dwell for 1/2 second
M300 P400 S4000

M0 Click After Loading New Filament
G4 P500 ; Dwell for 1/2 second

G1 E100 F300 ; load filament
G1 E20 F100 ; attempt to purge

M0 Click After Cleaning
G4 P500 ; Dwell for 1/2 second

G1 E-2 F6000 ; quick retract
G1 Z-30 F1000 ; move back down
G1 E2 F6000 ; quick unretract
G1 F300

G90 ; absolute positioning
M83 ; extruder relative mode
G92 E0 ; Reset Extruder
```
(I have already tested removing everything but the G1 moves and the G90/91 moves, and it gives the same result)

The custom gcode worked fine yesterday, but today it was giving problems, I went through my print profiles to try isolating the issue, and it seems that it only happens when "Max volumetric slope positive/negative" are set to a non-zero value.

### Project file & How to reproduce

[problem.zip](https://github.com/prusa3d/PrusaSlicer/files/13182634/problem.zip)
![image](https://github.com/prusa3d/PrusaSlicer/assets/108598670/29634f32-78e8-45fa-9baa-28afd6ebd762)
(notice that the nozzle plummets _after_ the color change in the screenshot)

### Checklist of files included above

- [X] Project file
- [X] Screenshot

### Version of PrusaSlicer

Version 2.6.1+win64

### Operating system

WIndows 10

### Printer model

Modified Ender 2 Pro (octoprint/marlin2)

comment.body:
> I set up a custom color changing GCODE to help with several simple two color prints I needed to do.

This is quite strange way how to perform a color change. Color change should be handled by the firmware, not by such custom g-code. So the correct way is to configure the firmware and then just use command for color change (typically M600).

> happens when "Max volumetric slope positive/negative" are set to a non-zero value.

I can see that moves generated by pressure equalizer also contains Z coordinates. It seems it uses the last used Z coordinates, which is Z-30 in your case. That last travel in your custom g-code was performed still in the relative mode, but PrusaSlicer does not support/expect relative addressing in general (it is not possible to generate g-code with relative positioning, apart from relative extrusion positioning).

issue.title: Very laggy while moving the object, viewport crashes
issue.body: ### Description of the bug 2.6.0 release is very laggy on my PC. It is clearly a bug made within the new update. My PC specs: - AMD Ryzen 9 7900X 12-Core Processor 4.70 GHz - ASRock X670E Steel Legend - NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3070 - 32GB DDR5 600MHz CL32 RAM - Samsung 980 PRO 2TB M.2 SSD Drive PrusaSlicer uses RTX 3070 graphics card, not the integrated one. ____________ **Please note that those bugs do not happen on 2.5.0 release!!! The 2.5.0 release works great, I've checked it again today and no issues at all.** There are actually two bugs that I think are both related to some issues in viewport rendering: ### Low FPS, very laggy while moving the object Moving the object causes lagging, there is a huge delay and like 15 fps. On previous slicer version everything goes smoothly. You can see how it looks like in the video I've attached. More instanced of an object cause more lagging. This is not related to objects size - objects with 20 faces also lag a lot. ### Importing big files causes viewport to crash While importing big files (~1M faces) the viewport interface crashes and bed dissapears. Deleting the object causes the bed and interface to appear again. See the screenshots. _______________ Things that I've already tried and they didn't help: - updating RTX 3070 studio driver - making sure PrusaSlicer uses RTX 3070 - reinstalling PrusaSlicer 2.6.0 - using standalone zip from github (PrusaSlicer-2.6.0+win64-202306191221_signed.zip) - copying opengl32.dll to main slicer folder ### Project file & How to reproduce ### Low FPS, very laggy while moving the object 1. Add any object 2. Add a few instances 3. Move the object ### Importing big files causes viewport to crash 1. Add a big object (around 1M faces) 2. Viewport interface and bed disappears 3. Delete the object 4. Viewport interface and bed reappears again [bug_report.zip](https://github.com/prusa3d/PrusaSlicer/files/12061661/bug_report.zip) ### Checklist of files included above - [X] Project file - [X] Screenshot ### Version of PrusaSlicer 2.6.0 ### Operating system Windows 11 pro ### Printer model Prusa i3 MK3s+, Prusa i3 MK3s

comment.body: Seems that 2.7.0-alpha1 is ok regarding this issue. You should also try using this release and see if it works

issue.title: Multi-Material: Wipe Tower Allowed for Organic Detatchable Supports, but not Grid or Snug Detatchable Supports
issue.body:
### Description of the bug

Trying to use detachable supports with multiple materials and a wipe tower gives an error message, but only with certain support styles.

The user should be able to print PLA with PETG detachable supports, wipe tower enabled, in a style other than organic.

### Project file & How to reproduce

1. Create a new project
2. Set Printer to Original Prusa i3 MK3S & MK3S+ MMU2S
3. Check Print Settings > Support material > Support material > Generate support material
4. Set Print Settings > Support material > Options for support material and raft > Style to "Organic"
5. Set Print Settings > Multiple Extruders > Extruders > Support material/raft/skirt extruder to 2
6. Observe the lack of error message.
7. Change Print Settings > Support material > Options for support material and raft > Style to "Grid" or "Snug"
8. Observe error message "The Wipe Tower currently supports the non-soluble supports only if they are printed with the current extruder without triggering a tool change. (both support_material_extruder and support_material_interface_extruder need to be set to 0). Shall I adjust those settings in order to enable the Wipe Tower?"

In summary:
* MMU + Generate support material + Grid or Snug style + non-zero Support material/raft/skirt extruder = error
* MMU + Generate support material + Organic style + non-zero Support material/raft/skirt extruder = no error

### Checklist of files included above

- [ ] Project file
- [ ] Screenshot

### Version of PrusaSlicer

2.7.0-alpha1+win64

### Operating system

Windows 10

### Printer model

Original Prusa i3 MK3S+MMU2S

issue.title: Multi-Material: Wipe Tower Allowed for Organic Detatchable Supports, but not Grid or Snug Detatchable Supports
issue.body:
### Description of the bug

Trying to use detachable supports with multiple materials and a wipe tower gives an error message, but only with certain support styles.

The user should be able to print PLA with PETG detachable supports, wipe tower enabled, in a style other than organic.

### Project file & How to reproduce

1. Create a new project
2. Set Printer to Original Prusa i3 MK3S & MK3S+ MMU2S
3. Check Print Settings > Support material > Support material > Generate support material
4. Set Print Settings > Support material > Options for support material and raft > Style to "Organic"
5. Set Print Settings > Multiple Extruders > Extruders > Support material/raft/skirt extruder to 2
6. Observe the lack of error message.
7. Change Print Settings > Support material > Options for support material and raft > Style to "Grid" or "Snug"
8. Observe error message "The Wipe Tower currently supports the non-soluble supports only if they are printed with the current extruder without triggering a tool change. (both support_material_extruder and support_material_interface_extruder need to be set to 0). Shall I adjust those settings in order to enable the Wipe Tower?"

In summary:
* MMU + Generate support material + Grid or Snug style + non-zero Support material/raft/skirt extruder = error
* MMU + Generate support material + Organic style + non-zero Support material/raft/skirt extruder = no error

### Checklist of files included above

- [ ] Project file
- [ ] Screenshot

### Version of PrusaSlicer

2.7.0-alpha1+win64

### Operating system

Windows 10

### Printer model

Original Prusa i3 MK3S+MMU2S

comment.body:
That is expected behavior with current implementation. Snug supports are always printed with the same layer height as objects (layers are synchronized), unlike other types of support material (variable layer height - support layer height is different than object´s layer height). That being said, if you set contact Z distance to 0 (which should be set for your PLA/PETG example anyway) , the layers will be synchronized with all types of the supports (and it will be possible to use wipe tower).

> The user should be able to print PLA with PETG detachable supports, wipe tower enabled, in a style other than organic.

That is possible. To do that, you have to set contact Z distance to 0 (soluble).

I am closing this issue. All related topics are already covered in other existing issues.

issue.title: App is nearly inaccessible for blind users
issue.body:
### Version
_2.4.0_

### Operating system
Windows 10/11 and Mac Bigsur; Linux to be tested

### Behavior
#### Expected Results
Blind users should be able to reach all interface options, all controls should be properly labeled and navigation using Tab Key should be possible
#### Actual Results
Application is inaccessible and nearly unusable, tested using [NVDA Screenreader](https://github.com/nvaccess/nvda)
I, as a blind person, am able to use this app only using OCR and chierarchical navigation, which are extremely advanced techniques. For an average blind user this program would be completely unusable.
The program uses a lot of graphics (for bed visualisation, for example) and making it completely accessible requires an enormous amount of commitment, but basic accessibility should be easier to achieve. The most important steps include:
* Labeling checkboxes and editboxes in a way that screenreader will be able to identify those labels,
* Enabling users to navigate between controls using Tab key, or other shortcut. Currently it is possible to navigate to tab bar only by using chierarchical navigation - a method of accessing controls directly by requesting windows chierarchy information from UI,
* Properly labeling menu entries.
While I know that this may sound unbelievable that blind people will get involved in 3D printing, I am an example that it may happen.

If you are interested in enabling the blind to use the program, I also offer my help both as a tester and a programmer.

comment.body:
Hello Dawid and others.

We are taking the issue seriously, however we don't have the resources for
such a complex topic now. However there is a UI research lab here in Prague
that I used to be associated with, that may help us to look into it in the
long term, maybe by assigning the topic as a master or bachelor thesis. I
have already contacted them.

Vojtech



čt 26. 10. 2023 v 18:45 odesílatel Dawid Pieper ***@***.***>
napsal:

> If Prusa is not interested in making their software accessible for blind
> users we could think about a fork. But unfortunately I don't have time to
> make it up to date every upstream release. :(
> Would be nice to have a clear declaration on this topic.
>
> —

pull_request.title: add some missing includes
pull_request.body: Some files used functionality without including the corresponding header file. This might have worked on the developer's machine from some indirect includes of those files but does not work on all systems.

issue.title: Pressure Equalizer causes relative moves from Custom GCODE to be copied to Main GCODE
issue.body:
### Description of the bug

### TLDR:
*I have a custom color change GCODE that utilizes relative positioning to move the Z axis up 30mm, then down 30mm(then sets back to absolute positioning). When the pressure equalizer settings are enabled, it causes G1 Z-30 moves to be inserted unpredictably/repeatedly on the regular extruding GCODE.*

### More:
I set up a custom color changing GCODE to help with several simple two color prints I needed to do. PrusaSlicer does not support the "layer_z" or other similar variables in the color change GCODE, so I had to just use relative positioning to get the job done. Here is what I wrote:
```G91 ; relative positioning
M83 ; extruder relative mode
G92 E0 ;Reset Extruder

G1 E-2 F6000 ; quick retract
G1 Z30 F1000 ; move up
G1 E-100 F300 ; unload

M300 P100 S3000 ; play tone
G4 P500 ; Dwell for 1/2 second
M300 P400 S4000

M0 Click After Loading New Filament
G4 P500 ; Dwell for 1/2 second

G1 E100 F300 ; load filament
G1 E20 F100 ; attempt to purge

M0 Click After Cleaning
G4 P500 ; Dwell for 1/2 second

G1 E-2 F6000 ; quick retract
G1 Z-30 F1000 ; move back down
G1 E2 F6000 ; quick unretract
G1 F300

G90 ; absolute positioning
M83 ; extruder relative mode
G92 E0 ; Reset Extruder```
(I have already tested removing everything but the G1 moves and the G90/91 moves, and it gives the same result)

The custom gcode worked fine yesterday, but today it was giving problems, I went through my print profiles to try isolating the issue, and it seems that it only happens when "Max volumetric slope positive/negative" are set to a non-zero value.

### Project file & How to reproduce

[problem.zip](https://github.com/prusa3d/PrusaSlicer/files/13182634/problem.zip)
![image](https://github.com/prusa3d/PrusaSlicer/assets/108598670/29634f32-78e8-45fa-9baa-28afd6ebd762)
(notice that the nozzle plummets _after_ the color change in the screenshot)

### Checklist of files included above

- [X] Project file
- [X] Screenshot

### Version of PrusaSlicer

Version 2.6.1+win64

### Operating system

WIndows 10

### Printer model

Modified Ender 2 Pro (octoprint/marlin2)

issue.title: Belt Printer Support
issue.body:
### Operating system type + version
_What OS are you using, and state any version #s_ Windows 10

### 3D printer brand / version + firmware version White Knight 1.0
_What 3D printer brand / version are you printing on, is it a stock model or did you modify the printer, what firmware is running on your printer, version of the firmware #s_  Duet Wifi2 version 2.02

_Is this a new feature request?_ Yes

Yes, please consider adding belt printer support for printers like the White Knight, Powerbelt 3D, Printrbelt, & Blackbelt so that there is an option besides Blackbelt Cura..

Thank you 
Karl Brown
NAK 3D Designs

comment.body:
> +1 Its so painful tho slice in other slicers. I use strictly prusaslicer but for my belt printer Im forced to use creality slicer and it just doesn't work.

I recommend you to try out ideamaker with belt printer support. It is still weird but waaaay better than the cura belt slicer version.

issue.title: SVG 'Use surface' feature not generated in Preview
issue.body:
### Description of the bug

### What is the problem?
When using the SVG 'Use surface' and 'Depth: 0.0' feature at resolutions other than 0.20mm (from print settings), the SVG feature is not rendered in the Preview window.
I tested 0.10mm FAST DETAIL, 0.15mm SPEED, 0.15mm STRUCTURAL, 0.20mm SPEED, and 0.25mm STRUCTURAL.
0.10mm FAST DETAIL - Result - Does not show SVG in preview
 0.15mm SPEED - Result - Does not show SVG in preview
0.15mm STRUCTURAL - Result - Does not show SVG in preview
0.20mm SPEED - Result - Shows SVG in preview
0.25mm STRUCTURAL - Result - Does not show SVG in preview
### What did I expect? 
I expect that when adding an SVG to an object and checking box 'Use surface' with 'Depth' set to 0.0 that the SVG image will be generated on the sliced model's face. This should occur at any resolution.

**Working example**
![image](https://github.com/prusa3d/PrusaSlicer/assets/46657562/412efdaf-3a94-4321-b63f-56a0e445d439)

**Non-working example**
![image](https://github.com/prusa3d/PrusaSlicer/assets/46657562/9af39c90-b1da-4fb5-9d3a-626a9ed66f76)



### Project file & How to reproduce

[SVG Use Surface Example.zip](https://github.com/prusa3d/PrusaSlicer/files/13168293/SVG.Use.Surface.Example.zip)
Steps to reproduce

1. Slice now
2. View sliced preview, confirm SVG is present
3. Return to 3D editor view
4. Change 'Print settings' on right hand side to '0.10mm FAST DETAIL'
5. Slice now
6. Confirm SVG no longer rendered in preview

### Checklist of files included above

- [X] Project file
- [X] Screenshot

### Version of PrusaSlicer

Version 2.7.0-alpha1+win64

### Operating system

Windows 11 Pro 22H2 build 22621.2428

### Printer model

Prusa XL 5T IS w/ 0.4mm nozzles

comment.body: Thank you for taking the time to educate me on this @Jony01! I appreciate it.

issue.title: Introduce new printer profile parameter "On Soluble Infill"
issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
In Issue prusa3d/PrusaSlicer-settings#214 (which is acted on and closed), I complained about the speed 60mm/s being used for Solid infill in soluble profiles since it induces resonances in the XL. I thought it could be set to 80mm/s (or higher) but it was explained to me that this parameter is *also* used when infill is printed on top of soluble support and that, for this reason, it can't be too high.

This seems a bit crazy to me. Solid infill is being printed quite a lot in a model. For most of the infill you want this high, but when printing on soluble material you probably want it pretty low (actually lower than the current 70mm/s.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
I would like you to introduce a new parameter under Printer Settings called, for example, "On Soluble Infill" which is used when solid infill is printed on top of soluble materials. Separating this parameter from Solid Infill makes it possible to optimize speed for printing infill in a model and speed for printing on top of soluble material separately.

issue.title: Slicer will not connect to Duet SBC with password
issue.body:
### Description of the bug

I am running Duet 3Mini5+ in SBC (Single Board Computer) mode.
Pruse Slicer is unable to connect  if a password is set on the Duet.  It will connect and is able to transfer files if there is no password.

In SBC mode, when a password is used, the Duet requires a session key in the http header. 

Below, for reference, is skeletal python code that illustrates a working connection .  Subsequent calls must include urlHeaders if a password is used.

```
global urlHeaders, timelimit, duetip
duetip = '192.168.30.30'
urlHeaders  = {}
timelimit = 5
duetip = '192/168.30.30'

password = 'mypassword'

def connect()
     url = ('http://' + duetip + '/machine/connect?password=' + password) 
     r = requests.get(url, timeout=timelimit, headers=urlHeaders)
     code = r.status_code
     if code == 200:
          # Connected to SBC printer
          j = json.loads(r.text)
          sessionKey = j['sessionKey']
         urlHeaders = {'X-Session-Key': sessionKey}
     #  trap other error codes
  
#  Get connected and get session key_
connect()
#  Follow on calls
```

### Project file & How to reproduce

100% reproducuble by selecting Test 
![Screenshot 2023-03-14 132826](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23531088/225116111-ee1bdacf-002f-412d-9d2e-0b611f76466d.png)


On the Duet (DSF) side, the error is reported as

`
Mar 14 13:11:44 srsender DuetWebServer[645]: DuetWebServer.Authorization.SessionKeyAuthenticationHandler[7] SessionKey was not authenticated. Failure message: Missing X-Session-Key header
`

### Checklist of files included above

- [x] Project file
- [X] Screenshot

### Version of PrusaSlicer

PrusaSlicer-2.6.0-alpha5+win64-202303061442_signed

### Operating system

Win11

### Printer model

Ender 5 Pro

comment.body: Looks to be working fine.  I tried a number of cominations, all with success.  Thanks!

issue.title: GUI: Object Manipulation Panel blank/unusable. PrusaSlicer-2.5.0+linux-x64-GTK3-202209060725.AppImage
issue.body:
### Description of the bug

Using the AppImage GTK3 version of PrusaSlicer-2.5.0, the "Object Manipulation" panel is completely blank and unusable.  



### Project file & How to reproduce

Open PrusaSlicer 2.5.0 AppImage, review Object Manipulation panel.

PrusaSlicer-2.5.0+linux-x64-GTK3-202209060725.AppImage
